page.title: 01BECKLEY & HORTON-CUM-STUDLEY
page.content: Our area includes Beckley, part of Horton-cum-Studley, and the hamlet of Woodperry.To the north lies Otmoor, a low fenland which has been the focus of much local concern having been threatened first by a scheme to turn it into a reservoir and now by the building of a motorway connecting the Midlands to the existing M40 at Waterstock. In 1985 no major roads cross our area. The B4027 from Wheatley to Islip passes through the bottom SW corner and was once the turnpike road from London with four inns near to Beckley. Much of the land was once forested and some woodlands remain. Beckley Park, a triple-moated hunting lodge built in 1540 is near one of the suggested routes of the motorway. Other large houses include Middle Park Farm, Grove House,Beckley; Studley Priory & Woodperry House.
